p.i: The House met at half-past Nine o'clock

speech.p: I hope that it will be possible this morning for all those Members who wish to do so to take the oath or to affirm without the need for any suspension of our proceedings. I intend to finish not later than noon. Before those elected for the first time last week come forward, I will take Members from earlier Parliaments who are present, and I see that there are quite a few.

p.i: The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by law:

speech.p: Resolved, That this House do now adjourn till Tuesday 13 May at half-past Two o'clock.—[Mrs. Bridget Prentice.]
